update.description:
This includes the modifications done for getting actor animation working. Please refer #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/538/gazebo-actor-sdf-13-parser-error for more details.

**Tested for:**
gazebo worlds/actor.world
turltebot simulator + RViz

**Known issues:**
If the actor skin file is set to sub_16.dae, walk.dae, stand.dae, talk_a.dae, talk_b.dae or run.dae, it renders the actor very weird. **Workaround** is to specify a working DAE (moonwalk.dae, sit_down.dae, sitting.dae and stand_up.dae) for <skin><filename> and load your desired animation DAE in <animation><filename>. It looks like the scale of the armature and mesh for not working DAEs are not same. Probably this may be an existing armature scaling issue.
update.title: Fix for actor animation not working

pull_request.title: Fix for actor animation not working

pullrequest.title: Fix for actor animation not working

content.raw: In pushing in the modifications, I came across some file attributes being changed for unknown reasons. Couldn't revert the changes back with 'hg backout'. So I created a different pull request at [fix-actor-animation-loading-and-rendering](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1133/fix-actor-animation-loading-and-rendering). I've run static code analysis and addressed your comments there. Hope we can continue any further discussion under that pull request and close this one.
content.html: In pushing in the modifications, I came across some file attributes being changed for unknown reasons. Couldn't revert the changes back with 'hg backout'. So I created a different pull request at fix-actor-animation-loading-and-rendering. I've run static code analysis and addressed your comments there. Hope we can continue any further discussion under that pull request and close this one.

pull_request.title: Fix for actor animation not working
